name: Meta & Governance
primaryQuestion: How critical is this work, what is its current status?
rationale: Keeps humans and CI aware of health, urgency, and blockers at any zoom level without polluting design content. Static plan docs carry only a pointer; live status tables sit in dedicated *-status.md companions (and inside each Task doc).
notes: Required at all levels; Task-level includes detailed progress tracking

sections.name: Status
sections.description: A section containing key status metrics for the document. The specific fields vary depending on whether it's a Plan or Task, with Tasks providing more detailed implementation tracking.
sections.contentFormat: Markdown `###` heading followed by a bulleted list.
sections.notes: Plan: Document lifecycle + strategic phase. Task: Implementation tracking + execution metrics.

fields.name: Created
fields.description: The timestamp when the document was created (e.g., `2023-10-27 14:30`).

fields.name: Last Updated
fields.description: The timestamp when this status block was last modified (e.g., `2023-10-27 15:00`).

fields.name: Current State
fields.description: The operational status of the task (e.g., `‚úÖ Done`, `‚è≥ In Progress`). See the standard status keys.

fields.name: Progress
fields.description: A percentage representing the completion of the task.

fields.name: Planning Estimate
fields.description: The initial story point estimate assigned during planning. This should not change after work begins.

fields.name: Est. Variance (pts)
fields.description: The difference between the final completed points and the `Planning Estimate`. A positive number indicates scope creep or underestimation; a negative number indicates overestimation.

fields.name: Implementation Started
fields.description: The timestamp when a developer began working on the task.

fields.name: Completed
fields.description: The timestamp when the task was marked as `‚úÖ Done`.

sections.name: Priority Drivers
sections.description: A bulleted list of stable Driver IDs that justify the priority of the artefact.
sections.notes: Plan: Business/strategic drivers. Task: Inherited drivers + technical execution drivers.
